result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Wayne Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def, to include if appropriate domestic abuse counsel, MRT, or Anger management.
Def to have NO ABUSIVE Contact w/J.L.
Upon successful completion of conditions of this sentence, this case record will be expunged per Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
Granted 4 days Jail credit from ACJ.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell Wayne Hughes

records.addlTxt:
03:28 PM Defendant Russell Wayne Hughes in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement- Def will plead to Count 1, Count 2 will be DRI. Withheld sentence, probation  of 1 yr conditions: domestic abuse counseling. other counseling, NAC with JL, Ct costs and surcharges, DNA, report to DOC. State complied with vic rights. Def waives right to an atty. rec'd compl in the case, waives reading of the compl. PLEADS G on Count 1, admit the crime was an act of domestic abuse. Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G on Count 1. Count 2 is DRI. State comments on sentencing. 
Ct orders-- withheld sentence, probation for 1 year. 
Conditions: 
other counseling, to include if appr, domestic abuse counsel, MRT, Anger management counseling
NAC with JL 
Ct costs, surcharges 
DNA within 7 days
Report to the DOC by the close of business tomorrow. 
Given age - EXPUNGE - if the def successfully completes the sentence the record will be expunge. 
Pay at DOC.  Granted credit for 4 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:34 AM Defendant Russell Wayne Hughes in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State appears by ZOO, def is in person. Def prev waived his right to have an atty, Def will still waive his right to an atty. Def rec'd letter from the State and would like to accept the offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:18 AM Defendant Russell Wayne Hughes in court.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Rec'd compl, def was denied a SPD. Ct gives the def options for an atty. Def would like waive right to an atty. Back on the record (11:25am) def is filling out waiver of atty paperwork. Back on the record (11:31am) Def filed waiver of atty form. Def signed waiver form. Def understands charges and range of penalties. Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Def to have no abusive contact with J.L.
Def to comply w/the 72 hr NO CONTACT.  After that time, No abusive contact.
